idAbs.para: Computes the geometric intersection of the patches of overlapping multipatches, then aggregates all multipatches into a single feature.

summary.para: Computes the geometric intersection of the patches of overlapping multipatches, then aggregates all multipatches into a single feature.

pythonReference.para: The closed multipatch features to be intersected, and aggregated.

dialogReference.para: The closed multipatch features to be intersected, and aggregated.

pythonReference.para: The multipatch feature class into which the aggregated multipatch(es) will be placed.

dialogReference.para: The multipatch feature class into which the aggregated multipatch(es) will be placed.

bullet_item.para: Input feature class or layer must have multipatch geometry.
Only closed multipatches will be processed.
All input features will be written out as a single feature.

Union 3D can create very large and complex features in the output feature class. These features may cause display problems and/or have poor performance when displayed. Use caution when deciding how many features to include in your input feature class.
All attributes of the input features will be lost.
